Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Montgomery -- 1% S&U - TC - 5 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Town of Montgomery, Louisiana, be authorized to levy and collect a one percent (1%) "sales and use tax" beginning on January 1, 2015 upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption and storage for service of items in the municipality, presently defined in Louisiana Revised Statute 47:337.1 through 47:337.84, subject to mandatory exemptions, with the annual tax levy amount currently estimated to be approximately $60,000, where said tax is and shall be used in all areas of town business including without limitation maintenance, upkeep, police and fire protection, and the term of the tax shall be five (5) consecutive years with the option of renewal for an additional five (5) year term by adopted ordinance of the Town Council and election in accordance with the Home Rule Charter, and where the provisions of the tax shall be the same as the provisions for the existing tax, ordained by ordinance number 140-2009, which had renewed that tax ordained by ordinance numbers 108-2005 and 101-2004, as such may have been thereafter amended or supplemented?

Shall the Town of Colfax, Parish of Grant, State of Louisiana (the "Town"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 29 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to levy and collect within the Town a tax of one percent (1%) (the "Tax") in perpetuity, from and after April 1, 2015, upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales of services in the Town (an estimated $132,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), all as defined by law, with the avails or proceeds of the Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collecting and administering the Tax), to be used for any lawful purpose of the Town?
